Tips._LCLZText: Select the body to export, set the refinement settings, then select the utility to send the mesh file to.

Description._LCLZText: The Refinement pulldown contains preconfigured mesh settings. Use the sliders under Refinement Options to customize the mesh settings.

TextBlock._LCLZText: 3D Print
Converts the selected body to a mesh body and outputs to STL or a 3D print utility.
Select the body to output. Set the mesh controls and specify the print utility to output to.

Tips._LCLZText: Select the body to 3D print, set the refinement settings, then select the utility to send the mesh file to.

Description._LCLZText: The Refinement pulldown contains preconfigured mesh settings. Use the sliders under Refinement Options to customize the mesh settings.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Select a mesh body to save as OBJ
Select a T-Spline body to save control frame as OBJ
Select a T-Spline body to save as IGA
Creates mechanical designs that contain mostly prismatic geometry. Access commands to create solid bodies.
Generates realistic renderings of the design.
Creates a solid box.
Select a plane, draw a rectangle then specify the height of the box.

Tips._LCLZText: Select a plane, draw a rectangle then specify the height of the box. Use the manipulators or the Operation drop down to control the effect the feature has on the design.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Creates a solid cylinder.
Select a plane, draw a circle then specify the height of the cylinder.

Tips._LCLZText: Select a plane, draw a circle then specify the height of the cylinder. Use the manipulators or the Operation drop down to control the effect the feature has on the design.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Creates a solid body sphere.
Select a plane then specify the center point of the sphere and the diameter.

Tips._LCLZText: Select a plane then specify the center point of the sphere and the diameter. Use the manipulators or the Operation drop down to control the effect the feature has on the design.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Creates a solid torus.
Specify the center point and diameter of the axis of revolution of the torus.

Tips._LCLZText: Select a plane then draw a circle to specify the major diameter of the torus. Finish defining the coil using the manipulators or dialog box.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Creates a solid coil.
Select a plane then draw a circle to specify the major diameter of the coil. Finish defining the coil using the manipulators or dialog box.

Tips._LCLZText: Select a plane then draw a circle to specify the major diameter of the coil. Finish defining the coil using the manipulators or dialog box. Use the manipulators or the Operation drop down to control the effect the feature has on the design.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Creates a solid pipe that follows a selected path.
Select the path then specify the section and size.

Tips._LCLZText: Select the path then specify the section and size. Use the manipulators or the Operation drop down to control the effect the feature has on the design.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Adds depth to open or closed sketch profiles or faces.
Select an extrusion type, select sketch profiles or faces to extrude, then specify the distance and taper angle. For the Thin Extrude type, specify the wall thickness.

Tips._LCLZText: Select the Thin Extrude type to create a thin wall extrusion along the selected open or closed profile. You can control the wall thickness and location, in addition to the adjustments you can make to a typical area extrusion.

Description._LCLZText: Adjust the Operation setting to control how the extrusion affects your design. You can join, cut, or intersect existing bodies to modify them, create a new body within the same component, or create a new body in a new component.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Revolves a sketch profile or planar face around a selected axis.
Select a profile or planar face and an axis to revolve around, then specify the extent type, direction, and operation.

Tips._LCLZText: Use the Project Axis option to project the axis to the same plane as the selected profile. Uncheck to return the axis to its original position.

Description._LCLZText: If you have a profile and a single center line selected then create a Revolve feature, the dialog will detect those selections and auto-select the Profile and Axis options.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Sweeps a sketch profile, planar face, or a solid body along a selected path.
Select a sweep type, an object and a path to sweep along, then specify the operation. Optionally select rails or a centerline to guide the sweep.

Tips._LCLZText: Select a sketch profile, planar face, or a solid body to sweep along a selected path. Optionally select rails or a centerline to guide the shape.

Description._LCLZText: For best results, ensure that the path is curvature continuous.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Creates a transitional shape between two or more sketch profiles or planar faces.
Select a series of profiles or planar faces to define a shape. Optionally select rails or a centerline to guide the shape.

Tips._LCLZText: Select a series of profiles or planar faces to define a shape. Optionally select rails or a centerline to guide the shape.

Description._LCLZText: Change the continuity from Free to Direction, Tangent or Smooth to refine the loft. Double-click on mapping point manipulators to drag all mapping points for a profile.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Raises or recesses a sketch profile relative to faces on a solid body by a specified depth and direction.
Select sketch profiles, select faces on a solid body to emboss, then adjust depth, effect, and alignment.

Tips._LCLZText: In parametric designs, emboss features maintain their link to the original sketch. If you edit the sketch, the emboss features created from that sketch will update to reflect the change.

Description._LCLZText: You can use the Emboss command to wrap text around a curved solid body. Adjust the depth, distance, and rotation angle to fine tune the result.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Creates a transitional shape between two or more sketch profiles or planar faces.
Select at least two profiles to define the loft. Refine the shape by using rail or centerline guides or point mapping.

Tips._LCLZText: Select at least two profiles to define the loft. Refine the shape by using rail or centerline guides or point mapping.

Description._LCLZText: Changing the continuity from Free to Direction impacts the influence of the corresponding profile across the loft. Set the Spacing setting to Curvature to add faces in areas of higher curvature.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Creates obstacle geometry bodies in locations of bolts or pins in an assembly.
Customize the size and shape of connector obstacles by adjusting the shaft length and diameter, and clearance for bolt heads, nuts, and tooling.

Tips._LCLZText: On the canvas, select the start and end of the shaft. Select edges or faces. Use manipulators to adjust the shaft diameter and length. To add clearance for bolt heads, select Bolt Head and specify the head diameter and length. To add clearance for a tool, select Tool Clearance and specify the clearance diameter and length.

Description._LCLZText: Select Flip Side to change ends of bolts and tool clearance.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Creates a thin feature from an open sketch profile, extruded to the nearest faces on a solid body. The rib feature is extruded in a direction parallel to the sketch plane.
Select an open sketch profile, then specify the thickness.

Tips._LCLZText: Project geometry from other features onto the sketch plane to quickly define the profile to use for the rib, and ensure the rib will update parametrically to reflect future design changes.

Description._LCLZText: Set Extent Type to Distance to specify a custom depth for a rib feature, instead of extending the profile all the way to the nearest faces on a solid body.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Creates a thin feature from an open sketch profile, extruded to the nearest faces on a solid body. The web feature is extruded in a direction perpendicular to the sketch plane.
Select an open sketch profile, then specify the thickness.

Tips._LCLZText: Project geometry from other features onto the sketch plane to quickly define the profile to use for the web, and ensure the web will update parametrically to reflect future design changes.

Description._LCLZText: Set Extent Type to Distance to specify a custom depth for a web feature, instead of extending the profile all the way to the nearest faces on a solid body.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Creates a hole based on user-specified values and selections.
Select a face to place the hole then select edges to position the hole on the face, or select sketch points to place multiple holes. Specify the hole type, tap type and size values.

Tips._LCLZText: Select a face to place the hole then select edges to position the hole on the face, or select sketch points to place multiple holes. Specify the hole type, tap type and size values.

Description._LCLZText: Select the center point of the hole to change the position. When creating tapped or standard clearance holes, the diameter is driven by the Size selected in the Use Standards section.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Add internal or external threads to cylindrical geometry. Threads can be cosmetic or modeled on the geometry.
Select a cylindrical face then set the thread specifications.

Tips._LCLZText: Select a cylindrical face then set the thread specifications.

Description._LCLZText: If necessary, the selected feature is resized to match the selected thread size.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Quickly arrange items on a plane or sketch for manufacturing.
Duplicates faces, bodies, features, or components in a design and distributes them along linear axes in rows and columns to create a rectangular pattern.

Select the object type, then select objects to pattern in the canvas, Browser, or Timeline. Select one or more axes to distribute the pattern instances along, then adjust distribution, quantity, and distance. Check Suppression, then uncheck instances in the canvas to remove them from the pattern.

Tips._LCLZText: Check Suppression, then uncheck instances in the canvas to remove them from the pattern.

Description._LCLZText: Set Distribution to Extent to specify the total distance to distribute the pattern along each axis. Set Distribution to Spacing to specify the distance between each pattern instance along each axis.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Duplicates faces, bodies, features, or components in a design and distributes them around a linear axis to create a circular pattern.

Select the object type, then select objects to pattern in the canvas, Browser, or Timeline. Select the axis to distribute the pattern instances around, then adjust distribution, quantity, and distance. Check Suppression, then uncheck instances in the canvas to remove them from the pattern.

Tips._LCLZText: Check Suppression, then uncheck instances in the canvas to remove them from the pattern.

Description._LCLZText: Set Distribution to Full to distribute pattern instances 360 degrees around the axis. Set Distribution to Angle to distribute pattern instances in one direction from the source object around the axis to an angle value that you specify. Set Distribution to Symmetric to distribute pattern instances symmetrically in two directions from the source object around the axis to an angle value that you specify.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Creates a pattern with size and distribution gradients across a face on a solid body.
Select the face to pattern across, select a solid body as the object to pattern, then adjust the size and distribution settings.

Tips._LCLZText: Adjust the size limits and spread to control the gradient across the pattern.

Description._LCLZText: Adjust the Operation to Cut material away from the existing body, Join material to it, Intersect the bodies to keep on the material that overlaps, or create New Bodies in the design.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Duplicates faces, bodies, features, or components in a design and distributes them to create a pattern along a specific path.

Select the object type, then select objects to pattern in the canvas, Browser, or Timeline. Select the path to distribute the pattern instances along, then adjust distribution, quantity, and distance. Check Suppression, then uncheck instances in the canvas to remove them from the pattern.

Tips._LCLZText: Check Suppression, then uncheck instances in the canvas to remove them from the pattern.

Description._LCLZText: Set Distribution to Extent to specify the total distance to distribute the pattern along the path. Set Distribution to Spacing to specify the distance between each pattern instance along the path.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Creates a copy of selected faces, bodies, features, or components, mirrored across a plane.
Select the objects to mirror, then select the mirror plane.

Tips._LCLZText: When you mirror solid or surface bodies, select the Join operation to combine or stitch the mirrored bodies together where they intersect.

Description._LCLZText: When you mirror features, select the Compute Option that works best for your design. Compute options can affect performance based on the complexity of the features you are mirroring.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Adds thickness to surface faces to create a solid body.
Select the faces to thicken, then specify a thickness value.

Tips._LCLZText: Select the faces to thicken, then specify a thickness value.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Creates, joins or removes volumes using bounding volumes formed by tool selections.
Select solids, surfaces or workplanes as tools to form volumes (or cells). These cells can be used to cut existing solids or to join to existing solids or to create a new solid.

Tips._LCLZText: Select solids, surfaces or workplanes as tools to form volumes (or cells). These cells can be used to cut existing solids or to join to existing solids or to create a new solid.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Identifies features in a body. Recognized features are listed in the browser.
Select the bodies then specify the feature types to identify.

Tips._LCLZText: Select the bodies then specify the feature types to identify.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Creates the surrounding volume from selected bodies. Surrounding volume can be internal or external to the bodies. The surrounding volume is created in a new component.
Select solid bodies, capping surfaces, or work planes as tools to form the surrounding volume.

Tips._LCLZText: Select solid bodies, capping surfaces, or work planes as tools to form the surrounding volume. Select the external shape then set the offset.

Description._LCLZText: A new component is created and the new bodies are added to that component.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Enters Form mode and inserts a form feature into the timeline. Use form tools to create and edit history-free bodies by pushing and pulling on vertices, edges, and faces. This is commonly referred to as T-Spline modeling.
Select Finish Form to exit out of the mode.
Return to the Design workspace.
Enters direct editing mode and inserts a history-free feature in the timeline. Actions performed while in the Base Feature are not recorded in the timeline.
Select Finish Base Feature to exit out of the mode.
Creates a new internal or external component in the assembly.
Select type and parent, then name the component. For external components, select location. For internal components, you can select bodies to create a component for each.

Tips._LCLZText: You can create external components to create a distributed assembly, where multiple team members can work simultaneously on different components. Click the Edit in Place icon next to any external component in the browser to edit it in context.

Description._LCLZText: After you create components, drag one into another in the browser to create a subassembly.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Return to the Design workspace.
Creates a surface body box.
Select a plane, draw a rectangle then specify the height of the box.

Tips._LCLZText: Select a plane, draw a rectangle then specify the height of the box. Use the manipulators or the Operation drop down to control the effect the feature has on the design.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Creates a surface body cylinder.
Select a plane, draw a circle then specify the height of the cylinder.

Tips._LCLZText: Select a plane, draw a circle then specify the height of the cylinder. Use the manipulators or the Operation drop down to control the effect the feature has on the design.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Creates a surface sphere.
Select a plane then specify the center point of the sphere and the diameter.

Tips._LCLZText: Select a plane then specify the center point of the sphere and the diameter. Use the manipulators or the Operation drop down to control the effect the feature has on the design.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Creates a surface torus.
Specify the center point and diameter of the axis of revolution of the torus.

Tips._LCLZText: Select a plane then draw a circle to specify the major diameter of the torus. Finish defining the coil using the manipulators or dialog box.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Creates a surface coil.
Select a plane then draw a circle to specify the major diameter of the coil. Finish defining the coil using the manipulators or dialog box.

Tips._LCLZText: Select a plane then draw a circle to specify the major diameter of the coil. Finish defining the coil using the manipulators or dialog box. Use the manipulators or the Operation drop down to control the effect the feature has on the design.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Creates a surface pipe that follows a selected path.
Select the path then specify the section and size.

Tips._LCLZText: Select the path then specify the section and size. Use the manipulators or the Operation drop down to control the effect the feature has on the design.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Adds depth to open or closed sketch profiles or planar faces.
Select the profile or planar face then specify the distance to extrude.

Tips._LCLZText: Select the profile or planar face then specify the distance to extrude. Use the manipulators or the Operation drop down to control the effect the feature has on the design.

Description._LCLZText: After selecting the profile, you can select faces or points to set the distance value. In parametric modeling, Set Extents to To to maintain an association with selected faces or points.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Creates a smooth shape that transitions between two or more sketch profiles or faces.
Select a series of profiles, planar faces, or non-planar faces to define the shape. Optionally, select rails or centerlines to guide the shape.

Tips._LCLZText: Select a series of profiles, planar faces, or non-planar faces to define a shape. Optionally select rails or a centerline to guide the shape.

Description._LCLZText: Change the continuity from Free to Direction, Tangent or Smooth to refine the loft. Double-click on mapping point manipulators to drag all mapping points for a profile.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Generates design alternatives between geometries in space that you want to connect.

Select at least two faces to connect. Optionally, you can select areas where you don't want to create new geometry. The alternatives are generated automatically. Explore them and select the alternative that best suits your needs.
Modifies the selected geometry using offset, extrude, or fillet commands. The operation depends on the geometry selected.

Tips._LCLZText: Select a face, edge or profile to modify. Press Pull can be used to offset a face, fillet an edge or extrude a sketch profile.

Description._LCLZText: In a parametric design, use the Offset Type options to modify existing features or to create new features.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Converts the selected face to T-Spline faces, edges, and vertices for modification.
Select the face to modify. Increase the length and width factors to add faces to give more control.

Tips._LCLZText: Select the face to modify. Increase the length and width factors to add faces to give more control.

Description._LCLZText: Use Coordinate Space to control the position of the manipulator. Use Selection Filter to control the types of objects available for selection.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Rounds the edges of a solid body by adding material to interior edges and removing material from exterior edges.
Select edges, faces, or features, then specify a radius. Use the Rule Fillet type to add fillets based on specified rules. Use the Full Round Fillet type to round the edges over three adjacent faces.

Tips._LCLZText: If you need to apply fillets of different types and sizes, you can create multiple selection sets within the dialog, then adjust the settings for each selection set separately.

Description._LCLZText: Fillets are applied to all edges of a selected face or feature. The Rule Fillet type only works on faces and features. You can use the Between Faces/Features rule to create fillets at the intersection of separate faces or features.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Bevels the edges of a solid or surface body by removing material from exterior edges or adding material to interior edges.
Select edges, faces, or features, then specify one distance, two distances, or a distance and an angle.

Tips._LCLZText: If you need to apply chamfers of different types and sizes, you can create multiple selection sets within the dialog, then adjust the settings for each selection set separately.

Description._LCLZText: Chamfers are applied to all edges of a selected face or feature. The Two Distance type lets you specify a different distance for each side of the chamfer, and flip them as needed. The Distance and Angle type lets you specify a single distance and an angle to control the form of the chamfer.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Offsets the walls of a solid body to create a hollow cavity with walls of a specified thickness.
Select a body to shell or faces to remove to create an opening, then specify a type, direction, and wall thickness.

Tips._LCLZText: Select faces then specify a thickness. The selected faces will be removed and the body will become hollow.

Description._LCLZText:
Use Rounded Shell type to shell complex geometry and create a full or partial outcomes, then use surface tools to modify the geometry.

Select the body in the browser to create a hollow body without removing faces.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Applies a fixed or parting line draft angle to planar faces.
Select a pull direction, parting tool, and faces to draft, then specify the draft angle.

Tips._LCLZText: To gain more control over the extent of a draft, use the Parting Line draft type and select a plane, face, edge, or sketch curve as a parting tool.

Description._LCLZText: The pull direction you select sets the direction of the draft. Faces to draft cannot be parallel to the pull direction.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Scales sketch objects, bodies, or components.
Select the objects to scale then specify the scale factor.

Tips._LCLZText: Select the objects to scale and the point from which to scale, then specify the scale factor.

Description._LCLZText: Change the Scale Type to Non Uniform to input different scale factors in the X, Y, and Z directions.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Joins, cuts, or intersects two or more solid bodies to create a single solid body.
Select the target body, select one or more tool bodies to combine with the target body, then select the operation to use to combine the bodies together.

Tips._LCLZText: Check Keep Tools to preserve a copy of the tool bodies in the design. If the combined result is hidden behind the tool bodies in the canvas, locate the tool bodies in the Browser and hide them.

Description._LCLZText: Check New Component to create a new internal component in the assembly to contain the combined result.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Shifts the selected face or faces in a positive or negative direction.
Select a single face or multiple faces and specify the Offset distance.

Tips._LCLZText: Select a single face or multiple faces and specify the Offset distance.

Description._LCLZText: Adjoining curved tangent Faces will Offset when geometrically possible.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Replaces one or more part faces with different face. The new face must completely intersect the part.
Select the face to remove then select the new face.

Tips._LCLZText: Select the faces to remove (Source Faces) then select the new faces (Target Faces).

Description._LCLZText: The target faces must completely enclose the source faces.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Divides faces using a selected profile, face, or plane as the cutting tool.
Select the faces to modify then select the profile, face, or plane that divides the source face.

Tips._LCLZText: Select the faces to modify then select the profile, face, or plane that divides the source faces.

Description._LCLZText: Use a sketch curve, construction plane, or the origin plane as your Splitting Tool.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Creates new bodies by dividing selected bodies using a profile, face, or plane.
Select the bodies to modify then select the profile, face, or plane that divides the bodies.

Tips._LCLZText: Select the bodies to modify then select the profile, face, or plane that divides the bodies.

Description._LCLZText: Use a sketch curve, construction plane, origin plane as the Splitting Tool.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Splits a body using surfaces generated from its silhouette curves.
Set the view direction by selecting a plane or axis then select the body and choose a split operation.

Tips._LCLZText: Set the view direction by selecting a plane or axis then select the body and choose a split operation.

Description._LCLZText: Silhouette Split works best with shelled bodies.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Moves the selected face, body, sketch, or construction geometry a specified distance or angle.
Select the objects to modify then specify the distance or angle. Use Set Pivot to reposition the manipulator.

Tips._LCLZText: Select the object to modify then specify the distance or angle. Use Set Pivot to reposition the manipulator.

Description._LCLZText: Change Transform to Point to Point to move the objects by selecting from and to points rather than entering distances. Check Create Copy option to create a copy of the entity during the move.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Moves an object (component, body, sketch, work geometry) by aligning geometry selected from the object with geometry selected elsewhere. Geometry can be a point, line, plane, circle, or coordinate system. Snaps are treated as full coordinate systems for full position and orientation alignment.
Select the point on the object to move then select the point on the face to align to. Click Flip and Angle to rotate the object.

Tips._LCLZText: Select the point on the object to move then select the point on the face to align to. Click Flip and Angle to rotate the object.

Description._LCLZText: Hold Shift to disable snapping. Hold Ctrl (Windows) or Command (Mac) to lock snaps on a face.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Assigns physical materials to components and bodies in a design to control their thermal, mechanical, strength, and advanced engineering properties, as well as their appearance.
Drag physical materials onto components or bodies in the canvas or the Browser. In the In This Design section, right-click physical materials to edit, duplicate, delete, or add them as favorites.

Tips._LCLZText: Drag the physical material from the dialog to the body or component.

Description._LCLZText: Right-click the material swatch in the In This Design section to edit, duplicate, and access other options.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Assigns appearances to components, bodies, or faces in a design to override the color and texture of their physical materials, without affecting physical engineering properties.

Choose whether to apply appearances to components and bodies or specific faces, then drag appearances onto components, bodies, or faces in the canvas or the Browser. In the In This Design section, right-click appearances to edit, duplicate, delete, or add them as favorites.

Tips._LCLZText: Drag the appearance from the dialog to the body, component, or face.

Description._LCLZText: Right-click the appearance swatch in the In This Design section to edit, duplicate, and access other options.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Opens the Material Browser, where you can manage physical materials and appearances in user-defined material libraries.

Navigate between libraries, create new libraries, and add physical materials or appearances to your Favorites. In custom libraries, edit the properties of physical materials and appearances, or create new ones.
Permanently deletes selected objects, and everything related to them, from the design. Does not create a feature in the timeline. Deleted objects cannot be restored parametrically.
Select components, bodies, sketches, and construction objects to delete. Use the Remove command to preserve parametric history.
Deletes selected components or bodies from the design and preserves the operation as a feature in the timeline. Removed objects can be restored parametrically.
Select components or bodies to remove. To permanently delete parametric history associated with an object, use the Delete command instead.
Resolve selected missing xRef objects.
Select missing xRefs from browser tree or from timeline to resolve.
Computes all of the parameters, features, and assembly relationships in a design.
Use at major milestones in the design process and after making significant changes to features in the Timeline, to ensure all assembly relationships are calculated properly.
Computes only the features related to unresolved external components in the assembly.
Only available when you open a design that contains unresolved external components. You must compute the features related to the unresolved components before you can edit or save the design.
Displays the Parameters dialog, where you can create and manage equations and relationships to control the size of objects.
Edit the name, expression, and comments for parameters. Create User Parameters to use in other expressions.
Shows or hides the Configure dialog without entering Configuration Mode.
Opens the Configuration Table, enters Configuration Mode, and highlights configurable features and objects in the Timeline and Browser.
Add Configurations as rows in the table to create different variants of a design. Click highlighted features and objects to add their configurable aspects as columns in the table.
Paste Command
Enlarges a surface by extending its edges a specified distance.
Select the edges of a surface, select an extension type, then specify the distance to extend. Select an edge alignment option to control the curvature continuity between faces.

Tips._LCLZText: You can extend edges through another shape and then remove the excess with the Trim command.

Description._LCLZText: Use the Perpendicular extension type to extend a surface 90 degrees from its original angle.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Duplicates components in an assembly and the joints attached to them.

Select components to duplicate, select a Joint Origin Mode, then select a Snap point to place each instance. If a component has multiple joints, select the next row in the selection box, then select a Snap point to place each instance.

Tips._LCLZText: As a best practice, use the Joint tool in tandem with Duplicate with Joints, rather than As-Built Joint.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Positions components relative to one another and defines the relative motion. Components maintain their current position.
Select two components, select a joint type, place the joint origin, adjust joint motion settings, then animate to preview the motion.

Tips._LCLZText: An As-Built Joint maintains the positions of components, and defines relative motions between them. You can use them when components don't need to be moved and you only need to define the motion.

Description._LCLZText: Place the pointer over over a face or edge and press Ctrl (Windows) or Command (Mac) to lock the joint origin snap to points on that object.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Position components relative to each other in an assembly, then defines the relative motion between them.

On the Position tab, place a joint origin snap point on each component to position them. On the Motion tab, select the motion Type, then adjust associated settings, add joint limits, and preview joint motion.

Tips._LCLZText: Hover over a face or edge and press Ctrl (Windows) or Command (Mac) to lock the joint origin snap to points on that object.

Description._LCLZText: Select a face or edge to limit selections to only points on that face or edge. Right-click and select Between to create a joint centered between two faces; select two faces from the same component then select a point.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Positions a joint origin on a component. Joint origins define the geometry used to relate a joint's components.
Select geometry to define the joint origin.

Tips._LCLZText:
Choose from 3 Joint Origin modes.
Simple: create a Joint Origin on a face or edge.
Between Two Faces: center a Joint Origin between two faces.
Two Edge Intersection: create a Joint Origin at the apparent intersection of two edges.
Use Joint Origin with Joint to define motion between components.

Description._LCLZText:
Select Joint Origin mode, select geometry, and snap the Joint Origin into position.
Adjust Alignment settings like Angle, Offset, and Flip to set the orientation of the Joint Origin.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Locks the relative position of the selected components. The components are treated as a single object when moved or when joints are applied.
Select the components to group together.

Tips._LCLZText: Use Rigid Group for three or more components to form a subassembly instead of creating a rigid joint between each pair. This helps reduce the number of features to compute in the Timeline.

Description._LCLZText: Add Joints between components in different Rigid Groups to define motion between subassemblies, and the entire group moves together.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Creates a tangent relationship between a face on a body in one component and a set of connected faces on a body in another component within an assembly.
Select a face on a body in the first component, then select a face on a body in the second component. The selected faces maintain a positional relationship tangent to each other.

Tips._LCLZText: Add joints first, then define tangent relationships.

Description._LCLZText: Select the faces that you want to maintain tangency to enhance the motion of the jointed assembly.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Specify the rotation angle or distance value for joint degrees of freedom.

Tips._LCLZText: Select a joint, then used the manipulators or the dialog to modify joint values.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Defines rotational and translational relationship between joint degrees of freedom.
Select the joints then specify the values.

Tips._LCLZText: Select two joints then specify their relative motion.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Activates contact analysis between components in contact sets. Contact sets are managed in the browser.
Turns off contact analysis for all component.
Activates contact analysis for all components.
Creates a contact set between selected components.
Select the bodies or components to participate in the contact analysis.
Performs kinematic motion analysis based on joints.
Select the joints to participate then specify points and values for the motion.
Inserts the selected component into the current design.
Select the component to insert then use the manipulator to adjust the position.
Inserts the selected component into the current design.
Select the component to insert then use the manipulator to adjust the position.
Enters Sketch mode, where you create geometric profiles that define the foundation of a design. Then use commands like Extrude, Revolve, and Loft to create 3D bodies from sketches.

Select a construction plane, then create lines, arcs, or points to create sketch and construction geometry. Constrain sketches with dimensions and constraints. Select Finish Sketch to exit Sketch mode.
Show/Hide sketch panel.
Creates lines and arcs.
Select a start and endpoint to define a line segment. Click and drag the endpoint of a segment to define an arc.
Creates a spline through the selected fit points.
Select the first point to start the spline. Select additional points as fit points.
Creates a spline driven by the selected control points.
Select the first point to start the spline. Select additional points as control points.
Creates a spline driven by the selected control points.
Select the first point to start the spline. Select additional points as control points.
Recommended for use in the Sculpt workspace
Recommended for general modeling workflows
Creates an individual sketch point to use as reference geometry.

Click in the canvas to create a point. You can snap to the grid or existing geometry. Use sketch points to define construction geometry, position hole features, space points on a spline, or connect lines in 3D space.
Creates a circle using a center point and diameter.
Select to define the center point then specify the diameter.
Creates a circle defined by two points.
Specify two points on the diameter of the circle.
Creates a circle defined by three points.
Specify three points on the circumference of the circle. The points define the size and position of the circle.
Creates a circle tangent to two sketch lines.
Select two lines then specify the radius of the circle.
Creates a circle tangent to three sketch lines.
Select three lines that the circle will be tangent to.
Creates an arc using three points.
Select the start point, end point, and then a point on the arc.
Creates an arc using three points.
Select the center point, then select start point and last select the end point or specify an angle value.
Creates an arc with tangency.
Select two points.
Creates a rectangle using two points for the diagonal corners.
Select the first point as the start of the rectangle. Select the second point or specify the width and height values.
Creates a rectangle using three points to define width, direction, and height.
Select the first point as the start of the rectangle. Select a second point or specify a distance value and pick a point. Select a third point or specify a distance value.
Creates a rectangle using two points to define the center and one corner.
Select the first point as the center of the rectangle. Select a corner point or specify width and height values.
Creates an ellipse defined by a center point, major axis and a point on the ellipse.
Select the center point of the ellipse. Select the second point to define the first axis. Select the third point to define a point on the ellipse.
Creates a polygon using the center point and the midpoint of one edge.
Select the center point of the polygon. Specify a value for the number of sides. Select the midpoint of an edge or specify a distance and select a point.
Creates a polygon using the center point and a vertex.
Select the center point of the polygon. Specify a value for the number of edges. Select a vertex point or specify a distance and select a point.
Creates a polygon by defining a single edge and the position of the polygon.
Select the start and end points of one edge or select the start point then specify a distance and angle. Specify the number of sides. Select a point to define the orientation of the polygon.
Creates a linear slot defined by placement and distance of slot arc centers, and by slot width.
Specify centers of both slot arcs. Click to specify slot width, or enter diameter of the slot arcs.
Creates a linear slot defined by orientation, length and width.
Specify the start and end on the slot center line. Click to specify slot width, or enter diameter of the slot arcs.
Creates a linear slot defined by a center point, location of slot arc centers, and by slot width.
Specify the slot center, and place center of a slot arc. Click to specify slot width, or enter diameter of the slot arcs.
Creates an arc slot defined by a three point center arc and slot width.

Specify the start and end point of the slot center arc. Specify the third point of the center arc, or enter center arc radius. Click to specify slot width, or enter diameter or radius of the slot arcs.
Creates an arc slot defined by a center point, two point center arc and slot width.
Specify the center point of the slot. Specify the start and end point of the slot center arc. Click to specify slot width or enter diameter or radius of the slot arc.
Creates a curve driven by endpoints and Rho value. Depending on the Rho value, the curve can be elliptical, parabolic, or hyperbolic.
Select the start point, end point, and then the top of the vertex. Use the guidelines to create a tangency constraint. Specify the Rho value for the desired shape of the conic curve.
Inserts text into the active sketch. Use text as a profile to create 3D geometry.
Select the insertion point and input the text. Modify the format of the text in the Text dialog box.

Tips._LCLZText: Place the first point to position the text. Click the Text field to begin typing the desired text. Rotate the manipulator to the left to change the angle of the text.

Description._LCLZText: The text box can be dimensioned and constrained.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Creates text inside a rectangular frame or along a selected path, which you can use as a profile to create 3D geometry.
Place the text frame or select the path for text to follow, then enter and format your text.

Tips._LCLZText: After you place the text frame, use the rotation manipulator handle to rotate it. Click any snap point on the text frame to change the point around which you rotate the text frame.

Description._LCLZText: You can dimension and constrain the text frame like any other sketch geometry.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Places an arc of a specified radius at the intersection of two lines or arcs.
Select the vertex or the two lines or arcs. Specify a radius for the fillet.
Creates a tangent or curvature continuous blend curve between the endpoints of two sketch curves or edges.
Select two sketch curves or edges in the canvas to blend.
Creates a chamfer at the vertex, intersection, or apparent intersection of two lines in a sketch, based on an equal distance to each side.
Select a vertex or two lines, then specify the distance value for the chamfer.
Creates a chamfer at the vertex, intersection, or apparent intersection of two lines in a sketch, based on a single distance and an angle.
Select a vertex or two lines, then specify the distance and angle values for the chamfer.
Creates a chamfer at the vertex, intersection, or apparent intersection of two lines in a sketch, based on a different distance to each side.
Select a vertex or two lines, then specify the two distance values for the chamfer.
Trims a sketch curve to the nearest intersecting curve or boundary geometry.
Pause the cursor over the curve to preview the portion to be trimmed. Select the curve to trim.
Extends a curve to the nearest intersecting curve or boundary geometry.
Pause the cursor over the curve to preview the portion to be extended. Select the curve to extend it.
Breaks a sketch entity into two or more segments where it intersects other sketch entities.
Pause the cursor over the sketch entity to preview where it will be broken, then click to break it.
Scales sketch geometry.
Select sketch geometry to scale, select the point from which to scale, then drag the manipulator handle in the canvas or specify an exact Scale Factor value.
Copies the selected sketch curves a specified distance from the original curves.
Select the curves to offset then specify the offset distance.

Tips._LCLZText: Select the curves to offset then enter an offset distance or drag the manipulator.

Description._LCLZText: The size and position of the new geometry is associated to the original geometry. To remove this association, select the offset glyph in the canvas then right-click and select Delete.

TextBlock._LCLZText: EDIT : Copies the selected sketch curves a specified distance from the original curves.
EDIT : Select the curves to offset then specify the offset distance.

Tips._LCLZText: EDIT : Select the curves to offset then enter an offset distance or drag the manipulator.

Description._LCLZText: EDIT : The size and position of the new geometry is associated to the original geometry. To remove this association, select the offset glyph in the canvas then right-click and select Delete.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Mirrors the selected sketch curves about a selected sketch line.
Select the curves to mirror then select the line to mirror about.

Tips._LCLZText: Select the sketch curves to mirror then select the line to mirror around. The mirror line must be a line in the active sketch.

Description._LCLZText: The mirror command also also adds a mirror symmetry constraint to the geometry.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Duplicates selected sketch curves in an arc or circular pattern.
Select the curves to pattern, the point to revolve around, and the quantity.

Tips._LCLZText: Select the curves to pattern then select the center point.

Description._LCLZText: A pattern glyph is placed at the center of the pattern. Double-click the glyph to edit the pattern.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Duplicates sketch curves in rows and columns.
Select the curves to pattern then specify the direction, quantity, and distance.

Tips._LCLZText: Select the curves to pattern then select the directions if they are not horizontal and vertical.

Description._LCLZText:
A pattern glyph is placed at the center of the pattern. Double-click the glyph to edit the pattern.

Set Distance Type to Extent to specify the total distance of the pattern. Set the Distance Type to Spacing to specify the distance between objects.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Projects the body silhouette, edges, work geometries and sketch curves into the active sketch plane.
Use the selection filter to project specific type of geometry or the body silhouette.

Tips._LCLZText: Set the selection filter then select the objects to project into the sketch.

Description._LCLZText: In the selection filter Specified Entities will project points, lines, arcs, etc. Bodies will project the entire silhoutte of the object selected.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Projects the points, model edges, work geometries, and sketch curves that intersect the active sketch plane.
Use the selection filter to project specific type of geometry or the entire model.

Tips._LCLZText: Set the selection filter then select the objects to project the intersection of the object and the active sketch.

Description._LCLZText: In the selection filter Specified Entities will find the intersection of points, lines, arcs, etc. Bodies will project the entire intersection cut of the object selected.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Rotates selected geometry around a specified axis and projects a 2D spun profile on to the active sketch plane.
Use the selection filter to project specific geometry types or the body silhouette.

Tips._LCLZText: Use Spun Profile to create turned profiles, then use them as a reference for turning operations in the manufacture workspace.

Description._LCLZText: Geometry selected with the Specified Entities filter project intersection of points, lines, arcs, etc. Bodies will project the entire intersection cut of the object selected.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Project sketch geometry, edge, vertex, or workpoint to selected faces.

Tips._LCLZText: Select the face to project on to then select the sketch curves to project.

Description._LCLZText: Start a new sketch to contain the projected geometry.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Include edges, work geometry, and sketch curves into the current sketch.
Select the objects to include.
Creates a 3D sketch curve from intersecting geometry.
The first selection is the sketch curve. The second selection is the sketch curve or faces to intersect with. You can select multiple curves or faces to intersect with.

Tips._LCLZText: The first selection is the sketch curve. The second selection is the sketch curve or faces to intersect with. You can select multiple curves or faces to intersect with.

Description._LCLZText: The projected curve and the selected sketch curve cannot be in the same sketch.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Create sketch dimensions for sketch geometries. Use dimensions to control the size or position of sketch objects.
Select the sketch curves to dimension then select an area to position the dimension.
Constraints dictate the position of geometry relative to other sketch geometries.
Constrains the position of two points or a point and a line or curve together.
This could be a point constrained along a line, two points constrainted to each other, or a point constrained along a curve.
Constrains two or more objects so that they share a common line.
This could be a line and a rectangle, where the line and one edge of the rectangle lie along the same line.
Constrains two or more arcs, circles, or ellipses to the same center point.
Constrains a point or object to the midpoint of another object.
Locks the size and location of a point or object.
Constrains two lines so that they extend in the same direction and never intersect.
Constrains two objects so that they lie perpendicular (at a 90-degree angle) to each other.
Constrains a single line, or two points, to lie on either the vertical or horizontal axis, whichever is closer to the current alignment.
Constrains a curve and another object so that they touch at a single point but never cross each other.
Constrains similar objects so that their sizes are identical. When the size of one object changes, the others adjust, too.
Constrains two or more objects so that they are symmetrical (identical to each other in relation to a common axis).
Constrains two or more objects to create a smooth, continuous curvature between them (G2 continuity).
Moves the selected sketch curve. Curves can be moved off the sketch plane to create a 3D sketch.
Select the curves to move then specify the new location.
Export active sketch to DXF. Export sketch geometries to DXF file, such as: point, line, circle, arc, ellipse and spline.
Exits the edit sketch state.
Creates a construction plane that is offset from the selected face or plane.
Select a face, plane, or sketch profile, then specify the offset distance. Use the construction plane as a sketch plane or as input for modeling tools like Split Body.

Tips._LCLZText: Select a face, plane, or sketch profile, then specify the offset distance.

Description._LCLZText: In Parametric Modeling mode, edit the plane feature in the timeline to change the position. In Direct Modeling mode, use the Move/Copy command to change the position.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Creates a construction plane through an edge, axis, or line at a specified angle.
Select a linear edge, axis, or sketch line to position the plane, then specify the rotation angle. Use the construction plane as a sketch plane or as input for modeling tools like Split Body.

Tips._LCLZText: Select a linear edge, axis, or sketch line to position the plane, then specify the rotation angle.

Description._LCLZText: In Parametric Modeling mode, edit the plane feature in the timeline to change the position. In Direct Modeling mode, use the Move/Copy command to change the position.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Creates a construction plane that is tangent to a cylindrical or conical face.

Select the cylinder or cone that the plane will be tangent to. Specify the position by entering an angle or selecting a reference plane and then adding an angle. Use the construction plane as a sketch plane or as input for modeling tools like Split Body.

Tips._LCLZText: Select the cylinder or cone that the plane will be tangent to. Specify the position by entering an angle or selecting a face to snap to.

Description._LCLZText: In Parametric Modeling mode, edit the plane feature in the timeline to change the position. In Direct Modeling mode, use the Move/Copy command to change the position.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Creates a construction plane at the midpoint between two faces or work planes. Use the construction plane as a sketch plane or as input for modeling tools like Split Body.
Select two faces or planes.

Tips._LCLZText: Select two faces or planes, and a new construction plane is created at the midpoint between them.

Description._LCLZText: In Parametric Modeling mode, edit the plane feature in the timeline to change the position. In Direct Modeling mode, use the Move/Copy command to change the position.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Creates a construction plane passing through two linear edges or axes.
Select two edges or axes. The edges or axes must be coplanar. Use the construction plane as a sketch plane or as input for modeling tools like Split Body.

Tips._LCLZText: Select two coplanar edges or axes, and a new construction plane is created to pass through them.

Description._LCLZText: In Parametric Modeling mode, edit the plane feature in the timeline to change the position. In Direct Modeling mode, use the Move/Copy command to change the position.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Creates a construction plane through three points.

Select three existing sketch points, construction points, or vertices for the construction plane to pass through. Use the construction plane as a sketch plane or as input for modeling tools like Split Body.

Tips._LCLZText: Select three points, and a new construction plane is created to pass through them.

Description._LCLZText: In Parametric Modeling mode, edit the plane feature in the timeline to change the position. In Direct Modeling mode, use the Move/Copy command to change the position.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Creates a construction plane that is tangent to a cylindrical or conical face at the mouse point.

Select a cylindrical or conical face, then select a point, on the face or on existing geometry like the origin, where the construction plane will be tangent to the face. Use the construction plane as a sketch plane or as input for modeling tools like Split Body.

Title._LCLZText: Plane Tangent To Face At Point Information

Tips._LCLZText: Select a face, then select a point or vertex, and a new construction plane is created to pass through them.

Description._LCLZText: In Parametric Modeling mode, edit the plane feature in the timeline to change the position. In Direct Modeling mode, use the Move/Copy command to change the position.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Creates a construction plane normal to an edge or sketch profile.
Select the path then specify the position of the plane along the path. Use the construction plane as a sketch plane or as input for modeling tools like Split Body.

Tips._LCLZText: Select the path then specify the position of the plane along the path.

Description._LCLZText: In Parametric Modeling mode, edit the plane feature in the timeline to change the position. In Direct Modeling mode, use the Move/Copy command to change the position.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Creates a construction axis through the center of a cylinder, cone, or torus.
Select a cylindrical, conical, or toroidal face for the axis to run through. Use the construction axis to reference a line that isn't represented by existing geometry.

Tips._LCLZText: Select a cylinder, cone, or torus, and a new construction axis is created to pass through its center.

Description._LCLZText: In Parametric Modeling mode, edit the axis feature in the timeline to change the position. In Direct Modeling mode, use the Move/Copy command to change the position.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Creates a construction axis through a point, perpendicular to a face on a solid or surface body.
Select a face at the point where the construction axis will pass through. Use the construction axis to reference a line that isn't represented by existing geometry.

Tips._LCLZText: Select a point on a face, and a new construction axis is created to pass through the point perpendicular to the face.

Description._LCLZText: In Parametric Modeling mode, edit the axis feature in the timeline to change the position. In Direct Modeling mode, use the Move/Copy command to change the position.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Creates a construction axis coincident with the intersection of two planes or planar faces.
Select two planes or planar faces.

Tips._LCLZText: Select two planes or planar faces, and a new construction axis is created to pass through each of them.

Description._LCLZText: In Parametric Modeling mode, edit the axis in the timeline to change the position. In Direct Modeling mode, use the Move/Copy command to change the position.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Creates a construction axis through two selected work points, sketch points or vertices.
Select two work points, sketch points or vertices.

Tips._LCLZText: Select two points, and a new construction axis is created to pass through them.

Description._LCLZText: In Parametric Modeling mode, edit the axis feature in the timeline to change the position. In Direct Modeling mode, use the Move/Copy command to change the position.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Creates a construction axis from selected linear edge or sketch curve.
Select a linear edge, axis, or sketch curve.

Tips._LCLZText: Select a linear edge, axis, or sketch curve, and a new construction axis is created along it.

Description._LCLZText: In Parametric Modeling mode, edit the axis feature in the timeline to change the position. In Direct Modeling mode, use the Move/Copy command to change the position.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Creates a construction axis, perpendicular to a surface or plane, at a selected point.
Select a face or sketch profile, then select a point.

Title._LCLZText: Axis Perpendicular To Face At Point Information

Tips._LCLZText: Select a face or sketch profile, then select a point, and a new construction axis is created perpendicular to the face at that point.

Description._LCLZText: In Parametric Modeling mode, edit the axis feature in the timeline to change the position. In Direct Modeling mode, use the Move/Copy command to change the position.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Creates a construction point at a selected point or vertex.
Select a point or vertex.

Tips._LCLZText: Select a point or vertex, and a new construction point is created at that point.

Description._LCLZText: In Parametric Modeling mode, edit the point feature in the timeline to change the position. In Direct Modeling mode, use the Move/Copy command to change the position.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Creates a construction point at the intersection of two linear edges or sketch lines.
Select two linear edges or sketch lines.

Tips._LCLZText: Select two linear edges or sketch lines, and a new construction point is created at their intersection or extended intersection.

Description._LCLZText: In Parametric Modeling mode, edit the point feature in the timeline to change the position. In Direct Modeling mode, use the Move/Copy command to change the position.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Creates a construction point at the intersection of three planes or planar faces.
Select three planes or planar faces.

Tips._LCLZText: Select three planes or planar faces, and a new construction point is created at their intersection or extended intersection.

Description._LCLZText: In Parametric Modeling mode, edit the point feature in the timeline to change the position. In Direct Modeling mode, use the Move/Copy command to change the position.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Creates a construction point at the center of a circle, sphere, or torus.
Select a circular edge or spherical face.

Title._LCLZText: Point At Center Of Circle/Sphere/Torus Information

Tips._LCLZText: Select a circular edge or spherical face, and a new construction point is created at the center point of the circular or spherical geometry.

Description._LCLZText: In Parametric Modeling mode, edit the point feature in the timeline to change the position. In Direct Modeling mode, use the Move/Copy command to change the position.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Creates a construction point at the intersection of a construction plane, planar face, or sketch profile and an axis or sketch line.
Select a plane, planar face, or sketch profile and an axis or sketch line.

Title._LCLZText: Point At Edge And Plane Information

Tips._LCLZText: Select a linear edge or axis, then select a plane or planar face, and a new construction point is created at their intersection or extended intersection.

Description._LCLZText: In Parametric Modeling mode, edit the point feature in the timeline to change the position. In Direct Modeling mode, use the Move/Copy command to change the position.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Creates a construction point at a specified distance along a path.
Select the path, then specify the position of the point along the path.

Tips._LCLZText: Select an edge to use as the path, select a distance type, then specify the distance, and a new construction point is created at the specified distance along the path.

Description._LCLZText: In Parametric Modeling mode, edit the point feature in the timeline to change the position. In Direct Modeling mode, use the Move/Copy command to change the position.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Measures the distance, angle, area, or position of selected objects.
Select an object to measure it, and optionally select a second object to measure it and the distance between them.

Tips._LCLZText: Select the geometry to measure. The results reported are determined by the type of geometry selected. The measurement is the minimum distance between the two selections.

Description._LCLZText: Click a value in the dialog to copy the value to the clipboard.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Reports the interference between selected solid bodies or components.
Select the components then click compute. Choose to create components from the interferences.

Tips._LCLZText: Select the components then click Compute to display results.

Description._LCLZText: Check Show All Interferences to highlight the geometry that has interferences in the model. Uncheck Show All Intereferences then select individual rows to display that interference.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Displays a comb with sample points along selected edges of a body to help you analyze the curvature of a surface.
Select edges to analyze on a body, then adjust the density and scale of the curvature comb.

Tips._LCLZText: You can analyze the curvature along a single edge or analyze curvature continuity at the transitions between connected edges.

Description._LCLZText: The Curvature Comb Analysis command only analyzes edges on bodies. To display a curvature comb on a sketch curve, right-click the sketch curve, then select Toggle Curvature Display.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Displays alternating black and white stripes on a body to help you analyze the curvature of a surface.
Select bodies to analyze, then adjust the direction, repeats, and opacity of the zebra stripes.

Tips._LCLZText: Zebra stripes show how light reflects off the surface. Use the reflections to identify and adjust areas to improve the aesthetic quality of the surface. The smoother the transition in stripes between surfaces, the better the continuity, and the smoother the surface will appear when it is manufactured.

Description._LCLZText: If stripe edges do not align, the boundary is not tangent (G0). If stripe edges align but contain a sharp angle, the boundary is tangent (G1). If stripe edges are smooth throughout, the boundary is curvature continuous (G2).

TextBlock._LCLZText: Displays a color gradient on the faces of selected bodies to help evaluate the manufacturability of your design.
Select the bodies to evaluate and the axis to define the direction. Use the options to refine the gradient display.

Tips._LCLZText: Select the bodies to evaluate and the axis to define the direction. Use the options to refine the gradient display.

Description._LCLZText: Use draft analysis to evaluate positions for a parting line or to find areas of zero draft or undercuts.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Displays a color gradient on bodies to help you analyze areas of high and low surface curvature.
Select bodies to analyze, then select a curvature map type and adjust the display settings of the curvature map.

Tips._LCLZText: For Gaussian curvature maps, warm colors indicate positive curvature, green indicates a flat surface, and cool colors indicate negative curvature. For Principal Minimum curvature maps, green regions meet the Maximum Limit threshold and red regions exceed it. For Principal Maximum curvature maps, green regions meet the Minimum Limit threshold and red regions exceed it.

Description._LCLZText: In the Browser, analyses are saved in the Analysis folder, where you can show, hide, and edit each analysis.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Used to colorize an object based on whether or not certain parts of the object are accessible from a particular plane.
Inaccessible areas are highlighted in red. Useful for checking undercut areas through a plane.

Tips._LCLZText: Select the bodies to evaluate and then set the analysis options.

Description._LCLZText: Regions that are accessibile will be highlighted green. Regions that are not accessible will be highlighted red.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Displays colors on the model that represent the minimum radius for the curvature of the concave faces.
Detect the minimum fit for holes and fillets. Useful for determining tool sizes in machining.

Tips._LCLZText: Select the bodies to evaluate. Use the options to refine the minimum radius.

Description._LCLZText: Regions with a higher curvature than the minimum radius will be highlighted in red.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Applies UV mapping and curvature combs to analyze the quality of a surface.
Select bodies or faces to analyze, select the isocurve type, then adjust the number of isocurves to display. You can also display curvature combs and control their density and scale.

Tips._LCLZText: In the Browser, analyses are saved in the Analysis folder, where you can show, hide, and edit each analysis.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Creates a view that cuts through all visible objects in a design to reveal interior details and obscured features.

Select a planar object to define the cut plane, then adjust the distance and angles to position it in the design. In the Browser, the Section Analysis displays in the Analysis folder, where you can adjust its visibility, edit it, or delete it.

Tips._LCLZText: Create multiple section analyses, then adjust their visibility in the Browser to switch between them.

Description._LCLZText: The Section Color option is set to From Component by default and displays the section view color coded by component. Set it to Custom to switch the entire section view to a single color that you specify.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Displays a center mark glyph at the center of mass for the selected objects.
You can measure from the center mark to other objects.

Tips._LCLZText: Select components and bodies to include. The center of mass is displayed after you click OK.

Description._LCLZText: The COM calculation can add to calculation time for other commands. Turn off the visibility of the center of mass node in the browser to exclude it from other calculations. The COM will be recalculated when the visibility is toggled on.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Displays each component in an assembly as a different color to make them easier to differentiate. Hides physical materials and appearances.
Press Shift+N to show or hide component colors in the canvas. Right-click a component and select Cycle Component Color to change its color.
Display face groups on mesh bodies to make them easier to work with. Hides component colors, physical materials and appearances.
Press Shift+F to show or hide mesh face groups
Places an image on a selected face as a cosmetic decal.
Select a PNG, JPG, or TIF image file from a Fusion project or your local computer. Select a face on a solid or surface body to apply it to, then adjust its orientation, scale, and opacity.

Tips._LCLZText: Select a face then select an image to import. Use PNGs to retain background transparency.

Description._LCLZText: Use the manipulators to move, scale, rotate, and flip the image. Selecting Chain Faces will allow you to span the image across multiple faces.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Places an image on a planar face or sketch plane.
Select a face then select an image to import.

Tips._LCLZText: Select a face or plane then select an image to import. Select display through to see the image through the model and use as a reference.

Description._LCLZText: Right click on the canvas image in the browser and select the Calibrate tool to set a specific distance between two points. This will resize the image based on that distance.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Places an image in the 3D space. The image will be placed in the center of current view and is oriented relative to the active camera.
Select an image to import then position and scale the image.

Tips._LCLZText: Select an image to import then position and scale the image. Select display through to see the image through the model and use as a reference.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Imports an SVG file into the active sketch.
Use SVG files for vector artwork such as logos or custom text.

Tips._LCLZText: Select the sketch profile or planar face then select the SVG file to insert. Set the position and the scale.

Description._LCLZText: SVG files are inserted as fixed sketch entities in the active design.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Inserts geometry from a DXF file into the active sketch.
Select a face or plane, select the DXF file to insert, then position the geometry on the plane.
Select the unit type that matches the units from the original design that generated the DXF.

Tips._LCLZText: Select a face or plane then select the DXF file to insert. Set the position of the geometry on the selected plane.

Description._LCLZText: Single Sketch mode inserts the DXF geometry into a single sketch. One Sketch per Layer mode creates a separate sketch for each DXF layer. Both modes only insert sketch geometry - solid and surface geometry is not inserted.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Insert a McMaster-Carr Component into the active document.
Browse to the desired component, click the Product Detail CAD icon, select the file type, then click Save.

Tips._LCLZText: Browse to the desired component, click the Product Detail CAD icon, select the file type, then click Save.

Description._LCLZText: SAT and STEP files are supported. The selected component is added to the active design as a new component.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Scripts and Add-Ins
Manage Scripts and Add-Ins
Displays the Scripts and Add-Ins dialog box. Create, edit, run, stop, debug and manage Scripts and Add-Ins.
Selection is always active and the active selection mode displays here.

Hold Ctrl (Windows) or Command (MacOS) to add objects to or remove objects from the selection. Change the active selection mode by selecting the mode you want to work with from the menu. Use the selection mode and selection filters to fine tune selection.
Selects objects enclosed in a rectangular selection area.

Click and drag from upper-left to lower-right (window selection) to select objects enclosed by the selection boundary. Click and drag from lower-right to upper-left (crossing selection) to select all visible objects the selection boundary intersects and encloses.
Use Selection Filters to include or exclude objects by type.
Selects objects enclosed in an irregular (lasso) selection area.
A clockwise boundary shape selects all objects within the boundary. A counterclockwise boundary shape selects all visible objects crossed by the boundary.
Use Selection Filters to include or exclude objects by type.
Press and hold the left mouse button and move across objects to select them.
Use Selection Filters to include or exclude objects by type.
Selects bodies or components by the name used in the Browser.
Enter a portion of the object name, check the object types to include, then click Find. You can search using one or more characters or words, finding only objects having that string in the name.
Selects objects using a boundary shape you choose.
Select a body to set the centroid, boundary shape, Selection Type, and whether intersected objects are selected.
Selects bodies within a size range that you specify.
Use the slider controls or specify the minimum and maximum size values. The size value is the distance between the opposing diagonal corners of the body bounding box.
Switches the selection state of all objects.
Selection is based on the active selection filter and selection mode.
Enables or disables the movement of components by dragging in the canvas.
Hold Alt to drag components when Component Drag is disabled.
Sets the selection filter to Bodies, and prevents selection of other object types.
Click a body to select it. Hold Ctrl (Windows) or Command (MacOS) to add objects to or remove objects from the selection. Click Select Body Priority again to restore selection of any object type.
Sets the selection filter to Body Faces, and prevents selection of other object types.
Click a face to select it. Hold Ctrl (Windows) or Command (MacOS) to add objects to or remove objects from the selection. Click Select Face Priority again to restore selection of any object type.
Sets the selection filter to Body Edges, and prevents selection of other object types.

Click an edge on a body to select it. Hold Ctrl (Windows) or Command (MacOS) to add objects to or remove objects from the selection. Click Select Edge Priority again to restore selection of any object type.
Sets the selection filter to Components, and prevents selection of other object types.

Click a component to select it. Hold Ctrl (Windows) or Command (MacOS) to add objects to or remove objects from the selection. Click Select Component Priority again to restore selection of any object type.
Specifies which object types can be selected.

Use Select All to include or exclude all object types. Check only specific types to limit selection to those types. Check Select Through to enable selection of hidden objects during Window or Freeform selection.
Set the environment and lighting for the scene. This setting only affects the Rendering workspace.

Tips._LCLZText: Set the environment and lighting for the scene. This settings only affects the Rendering workspace.

Description._LCLZText: Open the Environment Library tab to apply a pre-configured lighting setup, download new environments from the cloud, or attach a custom HDR environment. Brightness adjusts the lighting intensity, and Rotation adjusts the location of lights and shadows.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Sets the orientation of the texture applied to the body or component.
Select the object to modify then the Projection Type and the Axis. Modify the Mapping Transform using the manipulator or fields in the dialog.

Tips._LCLZText: Select the object to modify then the Projection Type and the Axis. Modify the Mapping Transform usimg the manipulator or fields in the dialog.

Description._LCLZText: Use Projection Type to control how the texture is wrapped onto the body or component. Use the Mapping Transform to control the position of the texture.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Deletes selected faces.
Select faces to remove. Neighboring faces are automatically deleted, as appropriate, in order to heal the model.

Tips._LCLZText: This will delete a group of faces and use the surrounding faces to maintain a valid 3D body.

Description._LCLZText: If the desired effect is not achieved undo and select additional surfaces or less surfaces and try the command or try manual selection and the delete key.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Automatically deletes features from selected objects.
Select objects, from which to delete features, and choose appropriate settings. Associated features are selected and deleted accordingly.

Tips._LCLZText: This tool allows the fast removal of simple features like chamfers, and small holes.

Description._LCLZText: Set the tolerance and look at the highlighted features that will be removed. If a valid body can't be obtained after removal try adjusting the tolerance with the slider.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Automatically creates a selection set that includes faces on a solid or surface body that are located between a set of boundary objects and a seed object.

Select faces or edges on a solid or surface body to define the selection boundary, then select a face on the body to use as the seed object for the selection set. Click Update to refresh the selection set based on the current boundary and seed objects.

Tips._LCLZText: Select one or more faces or edges on a solid or surface body to define the boundary of the area where you want to create your selection set.

Description._LCLZText: Consider all possible paths between the boundary objects and the seed object. For example, if there are holes between the inside and outside of the body, then both internal and external faces will be included in the selection set unless you include the edges or faces of the holes as boundary objects.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Selects faces adjacent to the selected object.
Replaces selected objects with primitive shapes.
Choose appropriate objects and define the replacement shape. The default primitive shape bounds all selected objects and the original objects are suppressed.

Tips._LCLZText: Replaces selected objects with primitive shapes (Box, Cylinder, Sphere).

Description._LCLZText: Select an object or group of objects to replace. Select the desired simple shape to replace the object or objects. The default shape will bound all of the selected objects and the original objects are suppressed.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Fills gaps in surfaces and shells.
Improves geometry by filling gaps between selected object edges. Choose the Extend or Patch options appropriate for the gap.

Tips._LCLZText: Fills gaps in surfaces or shells with a new surface.

Description._LCLZText: The gap fill command can be used to replace surfaces that didn't import into Fusion correctly, or to connect Midsurface shells. Choose between the different fill type operations to create a the desired new surface to fill a gap.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Pushes and links design features from the active design into a new or existing design. When you update the derived features in the original design, the changes are reflected in the destination design.
Select a single component or a set of components, bodies, sketches, construction geometry, flat patterns, or parameters to derive from the active design.

Tips._LCLZText: Before you start Insert Derive, activate the component that you want to contain the derived design features. Select objects in the canvas or browser to add to the list of derived objects. When you select a component, all objects in the component are included. Click the X button in the dialog to remove selected objects from the list.

Description._LCLZText: Use Derive to maintain common parameters in a single design and reuse them in multiple other designs design.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Pulls and links design features from another design into the active design. When you update the derived features in the original design, the changes are reflected in the destination design.

Before you start, activate the component that you want to contain the derived design features. Select a design, then select a set of components, bodies, sketches, construction geometry, flat patterns, or parameters to derive into the current design.

Tips._LCLZText: Before you start Insert Derive, activate the component that you want to contain the derived design features.
